metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 04 02

config.question: Which of the following statements contradicts the basic assumptions shared by the Enlightenment thinkers?

choices.content: Experimentation is as important as belief.
Everything operates according to certain natural rules.
God gave human beings the power of reason.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Philosophers of the Enlightenment replaced the concept of original sin with a much more optimistic view of human nature. The responsibility of right-thinking men and women, therefore, was to make certain that institutions such as church and state conformed to self-evident natural laws. See L.O. 4.2 How did European ideas affect eighteenth-century American life?
